episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' features a variety of quirky and intriguing facts, including discussions about alien life, the language of Jabba the Hutt, the history of tennis rackets, and the first female dentist in England. The hosts also delve into topics like the origins of Pilates, the invention of spray paint, and the peculiarities of sumo wrestling.

facts.fact: A computer engineer for the astronomy department at a prestigious US university says every single faculty member firmly believes that alien life probably exists, but the distances are too big and the laws of physics too rated for aliens to ever visit Earth.
10 million people in South America can understand Jabba the Hutt.
During his career, Rafael Nadal used 300 kilometers of string in 1,250 Babolat rackets.
The first female dentist in England was called Dr. Payne.
